steps.description: Empty and rinse all plastic containers thoroughly to remove any food or liquid residue
Remove and separate all caps, lids, and plastic films
Check the recycling number (1-7) on the bottom of the container
Flatten containers when possible to save space in your recycling bin
Ensure all paper materials are clean and free from food contamination
Remove any plastic wrapping, tape, or non-paper materials
Sort different types of paper (newspapers, magazines, office paper) into separate piles
Keep paper dry and protected from moisture to maintain recyclability
Remove all packaging materials including tape, staples, and plastic inserts
Break down all boxes completely flat to save space
Check for and remove any oil, grease, or food contamination
Keep cardboard dry and protected from weather
Empty and thoroughly rinse all metal containers to remove food residue
Remove paper labels where possible (adhesive residue is okay)
Crush cans and containers to save space, if required by your local facility
Separate different types of metals (aluminum, steel, tin) if required
Empty and thoroughly rinse all glass containers to remove any contents
Remove all caps, lids, and metal/plastic rings from containers
Sort glass by color (clear, green, brown) if required by your facility
Handle with care - do not break glass intentionally
This item should be disposed of in regular trash
Consider finding reusable alternatives to reduce waste
Check local waste management guidelines for proper disposal
If item contains hazardous materials, take to special waste collection sites
